tool_description: The Slapbots provides fun, short text-based one-liners. It includes Slap Jokes, Hairline Jokes, Tongue Twisters, “I Appreciate you like…” phrases and “I ♥ you more than…” phrases. All One-liners that anyone can use and modify as their own. The Slap Jokes, Hairline Jokes, Tongue Twisters are all hella funny, but the “Appreciation Phrases” and “Love Phrases” are really sweet and will make the heart melt.  Slapbots provide unique and original content written by professional British and English c...
name: Slapbot
title: Slapbot

api_list.name: /Slap
api_list.description: This endpoint allows performing GET requests to Retrieve Slap Phrases.  Slap Phrases are the most hilarious slapping insults and threats in plain text. •Examples of Slap Phrases include: "it will slap you so hard the tide will come in", "it could slap you harder than Chinese algebra", "it will slap you so hard your family tree will fall down", "it will slap harder than new prisoners hold soap"

optional_parameters.name: allowedCollections
optional_parameters.description: Collections are subcategories of the Product Category. Nearly all Slap Descriptions are grouped into one subcategory. • Examples of Collection: are "NSFW" or "SFW" . For the full list of acceptable Collections, use the following endpoint http://conflictapi.com/v1/api/Metadata/allowedCollections

optional_parameters.name: allowedRating
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a Rating against the allowedRating parameter means that all search results must have a rating greater than or equal to the specified Rating. This parameter must be set equal to a search Value in the Search Metadata Dictionary. •	Example: To search for Slap Descriptions which have Ratings of 3 or greater append&allowedRating=3

optional_parameters.name: id
optional_parameters.description: Id: is a number which uniquely identifies a description. This parameter allows you to store and retrieve specific Slaps.

optional_parameters.name: q
optional_parameters.description: Should be the search phrase generic search. With use space to separate words (url-encoded as either + or %20). Where the values provided may be found in the Slap Descriptions.

optional_parameters.name: requirePictures
optional_parameters.description: Setting this to “true” means to only return slaps with images or Gifs

optional_parameters.name: sortby
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a Sortby against the Sortby parameter will sort the description by the field provided in descending order. • Example: To search for Slaps sorted by best Star ratings, append &Sortby=rating. •	This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary.

optional_parameters.name: maxrecords
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a MaxRecords against the MaxRecords parameter will increase the number of rows returned by the Call to the value presented. Where the values can be any positive number less than or equal to 50. The default value is 1.
optional_parameters.default: Specifying a MaxRecords against the MaxRecords parameter will increase the number of rows returned by the Call to the value presented. Where the values can be any positive number less than or equal to 50. The default value is 1.

optional_parameters.name: allowedseverity
optional_parameters.description: Similar to the U.S. (MPAA) film rating system Severity is used to rate the content’s suitability for certain audiences based on its language. Valid data examples are PG, PG-13, R, NC-17. Specifying a Severity against the allowedSeverity parameter means that all search results must include slaps with the specified Severity(s) and will exclude any slap Descriptions that do not contain the specified Severity(s). This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary. •Examples of Severity: PG PG-13 R NC-17

api_list.name: /love
api_list.description: This endpoint allows performing GET requests to retrieve Love Phrases.  Love Phrases are amazing sweet phrases to help anyone express their love for someone. Use these quotes to make their day and delight them. •Examples of slapbot's Love Phrases include:  • "I love you more than angels love heaven",     •    "I love you more than I did yesterday, but not as much as I  will tomorrow...",  •  "I love you more than the moon loves the night"

optional_parameters.name: maxRecords
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a MaxRecords against the MaxRecords parameter will increase the number of rows returned by the Call to the value presented. Where the values can be any positive number less than or equal to 50. The default value is 1. The Parameter can NOT be specified more than once. •Example: To return 10 Love Descriptions, append &MaxRecords=10

optional_parameters.name: Sortby
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a Sortby against the Sortby parameter will sort the description by the field provided in descending order.  •Example: To search for Love Descriptions sorted by best Star ratings, append &Sortby=rating

optional_parameters.name: requirePictures
optional_parameters.description: Setting this to “true” means to only return Love Descriptions with images or Gifs links. •Example: To search for Love Descriptions which have pictures, append &requirePictures=true

optional_parameters.name: allowedCollections
optional_parameters.description: What are Collections: Collections are subcategories of the Product Category. Nearly all Love Descriptions are grouped into one subcategory. However, not all Love Descriptions are within a collection, in these cases, the collection will be listed as “none”. Specifying a Collection against the allowedCollections parameter means that all search results must include Love Descriptions with the specified Collection (s) and will exclude any Love Descriptions that do not contain the specified Collection (s).  •Example: To search for Love Descriptions which are a part of the Not safe for work collection append &allowedCollections=NSFW

optional_parameters.name: ID
optional_parameters.description: Id is a number which uniquely identifies a Love Description. This parameter allows you to store and retrieve specific Love Description. •Example: To search for Love Descriptions with ids, 2442, 2444, 2443 append &id=2444,2443,2442

optional_parameters.name: q
optional_parameters.description: Should be the search phrase generic search. Use space to separate words (url-encoded as either + or %20). Where the values provided may be found in the Love Descriptions. •Example: To search for Love Descriptions containing the words “Race Horse” append &q= Race+ Horse or q=Race%20 Horse

optional_parameters.name: allowedgenres
optional_parameters.description: All Love Descriptions are labeled with one genres of Humor. A literary genre is a popular categories of literary composition. Genres may be determined by literary technique, tone or content. Specifying a Genre against the allowedGenres parameter means that all search results must include Love Descriptions with the specified Genre(s) and will exclude any Love Descriptions that do not contain the specified Genre(s). •Example: To search for Love Descriptions which include only Humor Genres append&allowedGenres= Humor

optional_parameters.name: allowedseverity
optional_parameters.description: Severity is subcategory of the Collections Category. Nearly all Love Descriptions are grouped into one or more Severity. Specifying a Severity against the allowedSeverity parameter means that all search results must include Love Descriptions with the specified Severity(s) and will exclude any Love Descriptions that do not contain the specified Severity(s).  This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary.•	Example: To search for Love Descriptions which include only R-rated, Severity append & allowedSeverity=R

optional_parameters.name: allowedrating
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a Rating against the allowedRating parameter means that all search results must have a rating greater than or equal to the specified Rating.  •Example: To search for Love Descriptions which have Ratings of 3 or greater append &allowedRating=3

api_list.name: /Appreciate
api_list.description: This endpoint allows performing GET requests to retrieve Appreciation Phrases. Sometimes you want to say more than just thank you. Tell them how much you appreciate them with these light-hearted phrases.  •Examples of Appreciations Phrases include: "I appreciate you like the sea appreciates the horizon", "I appreciate you like a hummingbird appreciates the still of the wind", "I appreciate you like a cold appreciates a sneeze ", "I appreciate you more than a puddle appreciates the rain", "I appreciate you like milk and cookies on Christmas Eve"

optional_parameters.name: allowedRating
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a Rating against the allowedRating parameter means that all search results must have a rating greater than or equal to the specified Rating. This parameter must be set equal to a search Value in the Search Metadata Dictionary.  •Example: To search for Appreciation Descriptions which have Ratings of 3 or greater append &allowedRating=3

optional_parameters.name: Id
optional_parameters.description: is a number which uniquely identifies a Appreciation Description. This parameter allows you to store and retrieve specific Appreciation Description. •Example: To search for Appreciation Descriptions with ids, 2449, 2448,444 append &id=2449,2448,2447

optional_parameters.name: requirepictures
optional_parameters.description: Setting this to “true”  (via 0 or 1) means to only return Appreciation Descriptions with images or Gifs links •Example:  append &requirepictures=0

optional_parameters.name: q
optional_parameters.description: Should be the search phrase generic search. With use space to separate words (url-encoded as either + or %20). Where the values provided may be found in the Appreciation Descriptions.  •Example: To search for Appreciation Descriptions containing the words “Race Horse” append &q= puddle+ water or q=puddle%20water

optional_parameters.name: allowedseverity
optional_parameters.description: Similar to the U.S. (MPAA) film rating system Severity  is used to rate the content’s suitability for certain audiences based on its language. Valid data examples are PG, PG-13,  R, NC-17. Specifying a Severity against the allowedSeverity parameter means that all search results must include Appreciation Descriptions with the specified Severity(s) and will exclude any Appreciation Descriptions that do not contain the specified Severity(s). This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary.  •Example: To search for Appreciation phrases which include both R-rated and PG-Rated append &allowedSeverity= R,PG

optional_parameters.name: sortby
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a Sortby against the Sortby parameter will sort the description by the field provided in descending order. •Example: To search for Appreciation Descriptions sorted by best Star ratings, append &Sortby=rating

optional_parameters.name: maxrecords
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a MaxRecords against the MaxRecords  parameter will increase the number of rows returned by the Call to the value presented. Where the values can be any positive number less than or equal to 50. The default value is 1. •Example: To return 10 Appreciation Descriptions, append &MaxRecords=10

optional_parameters.name: allowedgenres
optional_parameters.description: All Appreciation Descriptions are labeled with one genres of Humor. A literary genre is a popular categories of literary composition. Genres may be determined by literary technique, tone or content. Specifying a Genre against the allowedGenres parameter means that all search results must include Appreciation Descriptions with the specified Genre(s) and will exclude any Appreciation Descriptions that do not contain the specified Genre(s). This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary.   •Example: To search for Appreciation Descriptions which include only Humor  Genres append&allowedGenres=Humor

optional_parameters.name: allowedcollections
optional_parameters.description: Collections are subcategories of the Product Category. Nearly all Appreciation Descriptions are grouped into one subcategory. However, not all Appreciation Descriptions are within a collection, in these cases, the collection will be listed as “none”.  Specifying a Collection against the allowedCollections parameter means that all search results must include Appreciation Descriptions with the specified Collection (s) and will exclude any Appreciation Descriptions that do not contain the specified Collection (s). This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary. •Example: To search for Appreciation Descriptions which are a part of the Not safe for work collection append &allowedCollections=NSFW

api_list.name: /Hairline
api_list.description: This endpoint allows performing GET requests to retrieve Hairline Insults. Let your users tell them how Jacked up that hairline is which these terribly awesome Hairline jokes.  •Examples Include: "Your hairline is shaped like a hashtag!",         "Why does look like your hairline is traveling south for the winter?",         "Your hairline looks like the McDonald's logo!"

optional_parameters.name: maxRecords
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a MaxRecords against the MaxRecords parameter will increase the number of rows returned by the Call to the value presented. Where the values can be any positive number less than or equal to 50. The default value is 1. •Example: To return 10 Hairline Insults, append &MaxRecords=10

optional_parameters.name: requirePictures
optional_parameters.description: Setting this to “true” means to only return Hairline Insults with images or Gifs links. • Example: To search for Hairline Insults which have pictures, append &requirePictures=true

optional_parameters.name: allowedGenres
optional_parameters.description: All Hairline Insults descriptions are labeled with one genres of Humor. A literary genre is a popular categories of literary composition. Genres may be determined by literary technique, tone or content. Specifying a Genre against the allowedGenres parameter means that all search results must include Hairline Insults with the specified Genre(s) and will exclude any Hairline Insults that do not contain the specified Genre(s). This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary. •	Example: To search for Hairline Insults which include only Humor Genres append&allowedGenres=Humor

optional_parameters.name: allowedCollections
optional_parameters.description: Collections are subcategories of the Product Category. Nearly all Hairline Insults are grouped into one subcategory. However, not all Hairline Insults are within a collection, in these cases, the collection will be listed as “none”. Specifying a Collection against the allowedCollections parameter means that all search results must include Hairline Insults with the specified Collection (s) and will exclude any Hairline Insults that do not contain the specified Collection (s). This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary. • Example: To search for Hairline Insults which include both Not safe for work and safe for work append &allowedCollections=NSFW&allowedCollections=SFW

optional_parameters.name: allowedRating
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a Rating against the allowedRating parameter means that all search results must have a rating greater than or equal to the specified Rating. This parameter must be set equal to a search Value in the Search Metadata Dictionary. •Example: To search for Hairline Insults which have Ratings of 3 or greater append &allowedRating=3

optional_parameters.name: q
optional_parameters.description: Should be the search phrase generic search. With use space to separate words (url-encoded as either + or %20). Where the values provided may be found in the Hairline Insult. •	Example: To search for Hairline Insults containing the words “Shape Hashtag” append &q= Shape+Hashtag or q=shape%20 Hashtag

optional_parameters.name: sortby
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a Sortby against the Sortby parameter will sort the description by the field provided in descending order. •Example: To search for Hairline Insults sorted by best Star ratings, append &Sortby=rating

optional_parameters.name: allowedseverity
optional_parameters.description: Similar to the U.S. (MPAA) film rating system Severity is used to rate the content’s suitability for certain audiences based on its language. Valid data examples are PG, PG-13, R, NC-17. Specifying a Severity against the allowedSeverity parameter means that all search results must include Hairline Insults with the specified Severity(s) and will exclude any Hairline Insults that do not contain the specified Severity(s). This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary.  •Example: To search for Hairline Insults which include only R-rated, Severity append &allowedSeverity=R

optional_parameters.name: id
optional_parameters.description: is a number which uniquely identifies a Hairline Insult. This parameter allows you to store and retrieve specific Hairline Insult.  •Example: To search for Hairline Insults with ids, 2435, 2436,444 append &id=2435,2436,2437

api_list.name: /MetadataSearch
api_list.description: We keep dictionaries of the possible values which can be used in our parameters. If a list of values are not applicable then some helpful text on how best to use the parameter is provided.

optional_parameters.name: Lookup
optional_parameters.description: Add here the parameter you wish to learn more about.  • Example: If you wish to know what values are valid for the allowedCollections parameter, the Lookup entry here would be allowedCollection.

optional_parameters.name: products
optional_parameters.description: To narrow the list of valid to a specific product, (i.e 'Slap, Hairline, etc) you would add a valid product name here. if you are unsure of the official name of vaild products. Use the /Metadatasearch endpoint with ‘allowedproducts’ as the lookup parameter value (ex: lookup= allowedproducts) or use the /productList endpoint

api_list.name: /tags
api_list.description: The tags end point provides hashtags that are linked to Phrases. •For example, the following hashtags are linked to slap descriptions. #JustBecauseSlap	#PottyMouthSlap	#SexySlap, #SlapbotFight

required_parameters.name: allowedpackages
required_parameters.description: A Package is the highest category of products offered by the API. Everything offered by the ConflictAPI is firstly organized into a package.  Specifying values against the allowedPackages parameter means that all search results must include tags linked to specified Package(s) and will exclude any tags that are not linked to the specified Package (s). The values provided when using this parameter must be equal to a value in the Search Metadata Dictionary. for the full list of acceptable Packages, use the MetadataSearch Endpoint with allowedProducts as the lookup value.

optional_parameters.name: allowedProducts
optional_parameters.description: Specifying values against the allowedProducts parameter means that all search results must include tags within the specified Product(s) and will exclude any descriptions that do not contain the specified Product(s). This parameter must be equal to a value in the Search Metadata Dictionary.  •Example: To search for tags which are a linked to the Slaps product append &allowedProducts=Slaps

optional_parameters.name: allowedGenres
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a Genre against the allowedGenres parameter means that all search Results must include tags with the specified Genre(s) and will exclude any tags that do not contain the specified Genre(s). This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary.• Example: To search for tags which include both R-rated and PG-Rated in commas between each value: allowedGenres=R,PG

optional_parameters.name: maxRecords
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a MaxRecords against the MaxRecords parameter will increase the number of rows returned by the Call to the value presented. Where the values can be any positive number less than or equal to 50. The default value is 1. • Example: To return 10 tags, append &MaxRecords=10

optional_parameters.name: q
optional_parameters.description: performs and returns the results of a generic search. With use space to separate words (url-encoded as either + or %20). Where the values provided may be found in the Slap Descriptions. •Example: To search for slaps containing the words “grilled cheese” append &q= grilled+cheese or q= grilled%20cheese

optional_parameters.name: Id
optional_parameters.description: is a number which uniquely identifies a description. This parameter allows you to store and retrieve tags specific to the content ID you specified. The ID parameter cannot be repeated more than once. When submitting this endpoint this is NOT the id of the returning tags, but the ID of the description which are looking for associating tags.  •Example: To search for tags linked to description id of 2428 append &id=2428

optional_parameters.name: PackId
optional_parameters.description: Is a number which uniquely identifies a Package. This parameter allows you to store and retrieve tags specific to the PackID you specified. The packID parameter can be repeated more than once. •Example: To search for tags linked to a package 4 via Packid, simply add & packid= 4 to the end point.

optional_parameters.name: productId
optional_parameters.description: productId is a number which uniquely identifies a product. This parameter allows you to store and retrieve specific tags linked to a product(s). Example: To search for Descriptions with ids, 13,23 and append & productid id=1,23

optional_parameters.name: allowedcollections
optional_parameters.description: What are Collections: Collections are subcategories of the Product Category. Most tags are not within a collection, in these cases, the collection will be listed as “” (empty string). Specifying a Collection against the allowedCollections parameter means that all search results must include tags with the specified Collection (s) and will exclude any tags that do not contain the specified Collection(s).  • Example: To search for tags which include both Power and Finesse append&allowedCollections=Power,Finesse

api_list.name: /ProductList
api_list.description: Get a list of all API product names, images and product content sizes for this API.

required_parameters.name: allowedpackages
required_parameters.description: A Package is the highest category of products offered by the API. Everything offered by the ConflictAPI is firstly organized into a package. Specifying values against the allowedPackages parameter means that all search results must include products linked to specified Package(s) and will exclude any products that are not linked to the specified Package (s). The values provided when using this parameter must be equal to a value in the Search Metadata Dictionary. for the full list of acceptable Packages, use the MetadataSearch Endpoint with allowedProducts as the lookup value.

optional_parameters.name: productId
optional_parameters.description: productId: is a number which uniquely identifies a product. This parameter allows you to store and retrieve specific tags linked to a product(s).  •Example: To search for Descriptions with ids, 13,23 and append & productid id=1,23

optional_parameters.name: allowedPublishers
optional_parameters.description: Publishers are the person or company which owns the rights to the content and has licensed or granted use of the content.  Specifying Publishers against the allowedPublishers parameter means that all search results will exclude any product where the publisher is not listed as the owner of that product. This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary •Example: To search for products which include those from Conflict Games, append &allowedPublishers = Conflict%20Games

optional_parameters.name: MaxRecords
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a MaxRecords against the MaxRecords parameter will increase the number of rows returned by the Call to the value presented. Where the values can be any positive number less than or equal to 50.  • Example: To search for tags linked to productid of 4,  append & productId =4

optional_parameters.name: overreleasedate
optional_parameters.description: overReleaseDate is supplied in the following format "yyyy-mm-dd".  Specifying a Date against the overReleaseDate parameter means that all search Results must have been re;eased to the public greater than the specified  date. Product release prior to the specified date will be excluded. • Example: To search for products released in append &overReleaseDate=2018-01-01

api_list.name: /Suggest
api_list.description: Users may suggest changes to improve the content with in the API. These suggestions are reviewed periodically and credit is provided to the user. The Suggest call is used to provide the details of a users suggestions.

required_parameters.name: contentid
required_parameters.description: Contentid is a number which uniquely identifies a description. This parameter is required to Identify which the description the suggestion pertains to. It is the same number/id you receive during GET calls such as (/slaps or /Twister)

required_parameters.name: contentedit
required_parameters.description: ContentEdit is this string value of the offered suggestion. o	Example: To send suggestions for descriptions with the id of 111 and a suggested text of “You’re Mamma is so fat, she jump up in the air and got stuck’  &Contentid=5&contentedit=You%E2%80%99re+Mamma+is+so+fat%2C+she+jumped+up+in+the+air+and+got+stuck

optional_parameters.name: SessionID
optional_parameters.description: SessionID is any value that uniquely identifies a user’s session.

optional_parameters.name: Userid
optional_parameters.description: Unique ID given to a user

api_list.name: /Twister
api_list.description: This endpoint allows performing GET requests to retrieve Tongue Twisters.  I bet you can’t say these challenging tongues twisters! Not just for kids, but are also used by actors, politicians, and public speakers who want to sound clear when speaking.

optional_parameters.name: q
optional_parameters.description: Should be the search phrase generic search. With use space to separate words (url-encoded as either + or %20). Where the values provided may be found in the Tongue Twisters Descriptions. •Example: To search for Tongue Twisters containing the words “Race Horse” append &q= Race+ Horse or q=Race%20 Horse

optional_parameters.name: maxRecords
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a MaxRecords against the MaxRecords  parameter will increase the number of rows returned by the Call to the value presented. Where the values can be any positive number less than or equal to 50. The default value is 1.  •Example: To return 10 Tongue Twisters, append &MaxRecords=10

optional_parameters.name: Sortby
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a Sortby against the Sortby parameter will sort the description by the field provided in descending order. •	Example: To search for Tongue Twisters sorted by best Star ratings, append &Sortby=rating

optional_parameters.name: allowedRating
optional_parameters.description: Specifying a Rating against the allowedRating parameter means that all search results must have a rating greater than or equal to the specified Rating. This parameter must be set equal to a search Value in the Search Metadata Dictionary.  •Example: To search for Tongue Twisters which have Ratings of 3 or greater append &allowedRating=3

optional_parameters.name: Id
optional_parameters.description: is a number which uniquely identifies a Tongue Twister. This parameter allows you to store and retrieve specific Tongue Twister.  • Example: To search for Tongue Twisters with ids, 2432, 2434, 2432 append &id=2432,2434,2433

optional_parameters.name: requirepictures
optional_parameters.description: Setting this to “true” means to only return Tongue Twisters with images or Gifs links. •Example: To search for Tongue Twisters which have pictures, append &requirePictures=true

optional_parameters.name: allowedcollections
optional_parameters.description: All Tongue Twisters are grouped into one Category (ex NSFW or SFW) . Specifying a Collection against the allowedCollections parameter means that all search results must include Tongue Twisters with the specified Collection (s) and will exclude any Tongue Twisters descriptions that do not contain the specified Collection (s). This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary. •Example: To search for Tongue Twisters which are a part of the Not safe for work collection append &allowedCollections=NSFW .   For the full list of acceptable Packages, use the MetadataSearch Endpoint with allowedcollections as the LOOKUP value.

optional_parameters.name: allowedgenres
optional_parameters.description: All Tongue Twisters descriptions are labeled with one genres of Humor. A literary genre is a popular categories of literary composition. Genres may be determined by literary technique, tone or content. Specifying a Genre against the allowedGenres parameter means that all search results must include Tongue Twisters with the specified Genre(s) and will exclude any Tongue Twisters that do not contain the specified Genre(s). This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary. •Example: To search for Tongue Twisters which include only Humor  Genres append &allowedGenres= Humor . For the full list of acceptable Packages, use the MetadataSearch Endpoint with allowedGenres as the LOOKUP value.

optional_parameters.name: allowedseverity
optional_parameters.description: Similar to the U.S. (MPAA) film rating system Severity is used to rate the content’s suitability for certain audiences based on its language. Valid data examples are PG, PG-13, R, NC-17. Specifying a Severity against the allowedSeverity parameter means that all search results must include Tongue Twisters with the specified Severity(s) and will exclude any Tongue Twisters that do not contain the specified Severity(s). This parameter must be set equal to a searchValue in the Search Metadata Dictionary. • Example: To search for Tongue Twisters which include both R-rated and PG-Rated •	append &= R,PG .  For the full list of acceptable Packages, use the MetadataSearch Endpoint with allowedSeverity as the LOOKUP value.
